document.topic_text: Close Mongolian wrestling coaches go nuts, strip down after unfavorable decision USA TODAY Sports' Rachel Axon tells you the five things to watch for during the final day of competition at the Rio Olympics. USA TODAY Sports Nate Scott, USA TODAY Sports , WXIA 12:10 PM. MDT August 21, 2016 Coaches from Mongolia thought their wrestler, Mandakhnaran Ganzorig, had won his match. When a ruling went against him they protested. Vociferously. p (Photo: Michael Madrid, USA TODAY Sports) RIO DE JANEIRO — Two Mongolian coaches stripped their clothes off after their wrestler Ganzorigiin Mandakhnaran lost the bronze medal match after the judges awarded a penalty point to Uzbekistan’s Ikhtiyor Navruzov. As the match ended, it appeared Mandakhnaran had won. His coaches sprinted onto the mat in celebration, one carrying the flag of Mongolia. Seconds later, it was Navruzov and his coach who were celebrating after the judges awarded the penalty point. Loading... Mongolia's Mandakhnaran Ganzorig's coaches react after the judges announced that Uzbekistan's Ikhtiyor Navruzov won folling a video replay in their men's 65kg freestyle bronze medal match on August 21, 2016. / AFP / Jack GUEZ JACK GUEZ, This content is subject to copyright. Mongolia's Mandakhnaran Ganzorig's coaches react after the judges announced that Uzbekistan's Ikhtiyor Navruzov won folling a video replay in their men's 65kg freestyle bronze medal match on August 21, 2016, during the wrestling event of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Carioca Arena 2 in Rio de Janeiro. / AFP / Jack GUEZ (Photo credit should read JACK GUEZ/AFP/Getty Images) JACK GUEZ, This content is subject to copyright. Mongolia's Mandakhnaran Ganzorig's coaches react after the judges announced that Uzbekistan's Ikhtiyor Navruzov won folling a video replay in their men's 65kg freestyle bronze medal match on August 21, 2016, during the wrestling event of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Carioca Arena 2 in Rio de Janeiro. / AFP / Jack GUEZ (Photo credit should read JACK GUEZ/AFP/Getty Images) JACK GUEZ, This content is subject to copyright. Mongolia's Mandakhnaran Ganzorig's coach reacts after the judges announced that Uzbekistan's Ikhtiyor Navruzov won folling a video replay in their men's 65kg freestyle bronze medal match on August 21, 2016, during the wrestling event of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Carioca Arena 2 in Rio de Janeiro. / AFP / Jack GUEZ (Photo credit should read JACK GUEZ/AFP/Getty Images) JACK GUEZ, This content is subject to copyright. Mongolia's Mandakhnaran Ganzorig's coach reacts after the judges announced that Uzbekistan's Ikhtiyor Navruzov won folling a video replay in their men's 65kg freestyle bronze medal match on August 21, 2016, during the wrestling event of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Carioca Arena 2 in Rio de Janeiro. / AFP / Toshifumi KITAMURA (Photo credit should read TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA/AFP/Getty Images) TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA, This content is subject to copyright. Mongolia's Mandakhnaran Ganzorig's coach reacts after the judges announced that Uzbekistan's Ikhtiyor Navruzov won folling a video replay in their men's 65kg freestyle bronze medal match on August 21, 2016, during the wrestling event of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Carioca Arena 2 in Rio de Janeiro. / AFP / Toshifumi KITAMURA (Photo credit should read TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA/AFP/Getty Images) TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA, This content is subject to copyright. Mongolia's Mandakhnaran Ganzorig's coach reacts after the judges announced that Uzbekistan's Ikhtiyor Navruzov won folling a video replay in their men's 65kg freestyle bronze medal match on August 21, 2016, during the wrestling event of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Carioca Arena 2 in Rio de Janeiro. / AFP / Toshifumi KITAMURA (Photo credit should read TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA/AFP/Getty Images) TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA, This content is subject to copyright. Mongolia's Mandakhnaran Ganzorig's coach reacts after the judges announced that Uzbekistan's Ikhtiyor Navruzov won folling a video replay in their men's 65kg freestyle bronze medal match on August 21, 2016, during the wrestling event of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Carioca Arena 2 in Rio de Janeiro. / AFP / Toshifumi KITAMURA (Photo credit should read TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA/AFP/Getty Images) TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA, This content is subject to copyright. Coaches from Mongolia protest the match of Ikhtiyor Navruzov (UZB) and Mandakhnaran Ganzorig (MGL) by taking off their clothes after the judges ruled in favor of Navruzov in wrestling bronze medal match. Credit: Michael Madrid-USA TODAY Sports Aug 21, 2016; Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; Coaches from Mongolia protest the match of Ikhtiyor Navruzov (UZB) and Mandakhnaran Ganzorig (MGL) by taking off their clothes after the judges ruled in favor of Navruzov in a men's freestyle 65kg wrestling bronze medal match during the Rio 2016 Summer Olympic Games at Carioca Arena 2. Mandatory Credit: Michael Madrid-USA TODAY Sports Michael Madrid, Michael Madrid Aug 21, 2016; Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; Coaches from Mongolia protest the match of Ikhtiyor Navruzov (UZB) and Mandakhnaran Ganzorig (MGL) by taking off their clothes after the judges ruled in favor of Navruzov in a men's freestyle 65kg wrestling bronze medal match during the Rio 2016 Summer Olympic Games at Carioca Arena 2. Mandatory Credit: Michael Madrid-USA TODAY Sports Michael Madrid, Michael Madrid Autoplay Pause Show Thumbnails Show Captions The two Mongolian coaches then tossed a challenge flag, and when the judges explained to them the call couldn’t be challenged, they ran out onto the mat while Mandakhnaran dropped to his knees. As the judges attempted to wave them off, the two coaches stripped down in protest — one removing his shirt, and the other removing both his shirt and pants, leaving on only his underwear. Security was brought in as the crowd started cheering “MONGOLIA! MONGOLIA!” Eventually security was able to escort the two coaches off the mat. Photos: Final day of competition at Rio Olympics Loading... RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 21: Fireworks explode during the Closing Ceremony on Day 16 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at Maracana Stadium on August 21, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Ezra Shaw/Getty Images) Ezra Shaw, 2016 Getty Images RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 21: Flag bearers enter the stadium during the 'Heroes of the Games' segment during the Closing Ceremony on Day 16 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at Maracana Stadium on August 21, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Bryn Lennon/Getty Images) Bryn Lennon, 2016 Getty Images Athletes parade during the closing ceremony of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Maracana stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 21, 2016. (Photo: JOHN MACDOUGALL/AFP/Getty Images) JOHN MACDOUGALL RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 21: Demar DeRozan and Kyle Lowry #7 of United States celebrate afer defeating Serbia during the Men's Gold medal game on Day 16 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at Carioca Arena 1 on August 21, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Elsa/Getty Images) Elsa, 2016 Getty Images Serbia's guard Nemanja Nedovic (C) jumps for the basket by USA's centre DeMarcus Cousins (R) during a Men's Gold medal basketball match between Serbia and USA during the Rio 2016 Olympic Games. (Photo: MARK RALSTON/AFP/Getty Images) MARK RALSTON RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 21: Nemanja Nedovic #11 of Serbia drives the ball around Kevin Durant #5 of United States during the Men's Gold medal game on Day 16 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at Carioca Arena 1 on August 21, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty Images) Alex Livesey, 2016 Getty Images RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 21: Shakhobidin Zoirov of Uzbekistan and Misha Aloian of Russia compete during the Men's Fly (52kg) Final Bout on Day 16 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at Riocentro - Pavilion 6 on August 21, 2016 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. (Photo by Matthias Hangst/Getty Images) Matthias Hangst, 2016 Getty Images USA's David Lee (C) and teammates celebrate after winning their men's Bronze Medal volleyball match against Russia at the Maracanazinho stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 21, 2016, at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games. / AFP / Kirill KUDRYAVTSEV (Photo credit should read KIRILL KUDRYAVTSEV/AFP/Getty Images) KIRILL KUDRYAVTSEV CORRECTION - Ialy's team compete in the group all-around final event of the Rhythmic Gymnastics at the Olympic Arena during the Rio 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro on August 21, 2016. / AFP / Thomas COEX / The erroneous mention[s] appearing in the metadata of this photo by Thomas COEX has been modified in AFP systems in the following manner: [Italy's team] instead of [Russia's team]. Please immediately remove the erroneous mention[s] from all your online services and delete it (them) from your servers. If you have been authorized by AFP to distribute it (them) to third parties, please ensure that the same actions are carried out by them. Failure to promptly comply with these instructions will entail liability on your part for any continued or post notification usage. Therefore we thank you very much for all your attention and prompt action. We are sorry for the inconvenience this notification may cause and remain at your disposal for any further information you may require. (Credit: TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA/AFP/Getty Images) TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA

Coaches from Mongolia protest the match of Ikhtiyor Navruzov (UZB) and Mandakhnaran Ganzorig (MGL) by taking off their clothes after the judges ruled in favor of Navruzov in wrestling bronze medal match. Credit: Michael Madrid-USA TODAY Sports Aug 21, 2016; Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; Coaches from Mongolia protest the match of Ikhtiyor Navruzov (UZB) and Mandakhnaran Ganzorig (MGL) by taking off their clothes after the judges ruled in favor of Navruzov in a men's freestyle 65kg wrestling bronze medal match during the Rio 2016 Summer Olympic Games at Carioca Arena 2. Mandatory Credit: Michael Madrid-USA TODAY Sports Michael Madrid, Michael Madrid Aug 21, 2016; Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; Coaches from Mongolia protest the match of Ikhtiyor Navruzov (UZB) and Mandakhnaran Ganzorig (MGL) by taking off their clothes after the judges ruled in favor of Navruzov in a men's freestyle 65kg wrestling bronze medal match during the Rio 2016 Summer Olympic Games at Carioca Arena 2. Mandatory Credit: Michael Madrid-USA TODAY Sports Michael Madrid, Michael Madrid Autoplay Pause Show Thumbnails Show Captions The two Mongolian coaches then tossed a challenge flag, and when the judges explained to them the call couldn’t be challenged, they ran out onto the mat while Mandakhnaran dropped to his knees. As the judges attempted to wave them off, the two coaches stripped down in protest — one removing his shirt, and the other removing both his shirt and pants, leaving on only his underwear. Security was brought in as the crowd started cheering “MONGOLIA! MONGOLIA!” Eventually security was able to escort the two coaches off the mat.
